subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Cardiac Cycle
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Cardiac Cycle.

hook.text: Every heartbeat has two phases. One fills the chambers. The other ejects blood with force.

buildup.text: Diastole is the filling phase â€” the heart relaxes and blood flows in. Systole is the squeeze.

discovery.text: The whole cycle takes about 0.8 seconds at rest. During exercise, it compresses to under 0.4 seconds.

twist.text: Diastole shortens more than systole. At very high heart rates, filling time drops â€” limiting output.

climax.text: This is why maximum heart rate is a real ceiling. The heart literally runs out of time to fill.

punchline.text: Your heart has a speed limit. Not from weakness, but from physics.
